input:
Sophia is a biologist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 13), my wife (birthday on September 19), my child_1 (birthday on September 06), my father (birthday on July 27), my mother (birthday on June 05), 
2) Attending a fashion week in Paris in week 24-25.

3) Attend a parenting workshop every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 13.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Sophia for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

checks_range.24: Attending a fashion week in Paris
checks_range.25: Attending a fashion week in Paris

Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

 Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
The chill of winter persisted, with temperatures hovering around 3°C. The frosty mornings were invigorating, and we took advantage of the crisp air for a brisk jog around the neighborhood. At work, the engineering team was abuzz with the kickoff of a new project aimed at developing sustainable building materials. I was tasked with leading a small group to explore innovative composites that could reduce carbon footprints. The challenge was exciting, and I spent long hours in the lab, experimenting with different formulations. At home, the kids were adjusting to their school routines, and we made it a point to have dinner together every night, discussing their day and sharing stories. My wife and I also found time to catch up on our reading, a small luxury we both cherish. The weekend was spent organizing the garage, a task that had been on our to-do list for months. It was satisfying to see everything neatly arranged, and we even found some old family photos that brought back fond memories. The week ended with a cozy movie night, where we watched a classic film and enjoyed some homemade popcorn. It was a simple yet fulfilling week, filled with small accomplishments and family bonding.

 Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
The weather took a turn this week, with temperatures rising to a mild 10°C. The sun peeked through the clouds, casting a warm glow over the city. At work, the project on sustainable building materials was progressing well. We had a breakthrough with a new composite that showed promising results in our initial tests. I was thrilled with the progress and spent extra hours in the lab, fine-tuning the formulation. The team was equally excited, and we planned a small celebration to mark the milestone. At home, the kids were busy with their school projects, and we helped them brainstorm ideas and gather materials. My wife and I also took the opportunity to plan our upcoming trip to Paris for the fashion week in May. We researched the best places to stay and the must-see events, making a detailed itinerary. The weekend was spent outdoors, taking advantage of the pleasant weather. We went for a hike in the nearby hills, enjoying the fresh air and scenic views. It was a refreshing break from our usual routine, and we returned home feeling rejuvenated. The week was a mix of professional achievements and personal joys, with the promise of exciting adventures ahead.

 Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
The week started with a surprise snowfall, blanketing the city in a layer of white. The temperatures dropped to a chilly -2°C, but the sight of the snow-covered landscape was magical. At work, the focus was on finalizing the details of the new composite. We conducted several tests to ensure its durability and efficiency, and the results were encouraging. I presented our findings to the team, and we discussed the next steps for scaling up production. The project was moving forward smoothly, and I felt a sense of accomplishment. At home, the kids were excited about the snow and spent the day building snowmen and having snowball fights. My wife and I joined in the fun, relishing the opportunity to play like children. The weekend was spent indoors, as the snow continued to fall. We baked cookies and watched movies, enjoying the warmth of our home. It was a cozy and relaxing week, filled with laughter and simple pleasures.

 Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th): 
The snow began to melt, and the temperatures rose to a mild 5°C. The city was slowly returning to its usual hustle and bustle. At work, the project on sustainable building materials was gaining momentum. We received positive feedback from the management, and I was assigned to lead a presentation for potential investors. I spent the week preparing the slides and rehearsing my speech, determined to make a compelling case for our innovation. At home, the kids were adjusting to their new school schedules, and we made sure to support them with their homework and extracurricular activities. My wife and I also attended our first parenting workshop, which focused on effective communication with teenagers. The session was insightful, and we learned valuable strategies to improve our interactions with the kids. The weekend was spent exploring a new hiking trail, enjoying the fresh air and scenic views. It was a perfect way to unwind and connect with nature. The week was a blend of professional challenges and personal growth, with valuable lessons learned along the way.

I was thrilled with the outcome and felt a renewed sense of motivation. At home, the kids were busy with their school projects, and we helped them stay organized and focused. My wife and I also took the time to plan our upcoming family vacation, discussing potential destinations and activities. The weekend was spent indoors, as the weather turned chilly again. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)

Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

 Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
The chill of winter persisted, with temperatures hovering around 3°C. The week began with a brisk walk to the local farmer's market, where we picked up fresh produce for the week. My wife and I enjoyed experimenting with new recipes, turning our kitchen into a culinary playground. At work, the focus shifted to finalizing the blueprints for a new residential project. The challenge was to incorporate sustainable materials without compromising on aesthetics. I spent several afternoons in deep discussion with the construction team, ensuring that every detail was meticulously planned. The kids adapted well to the school routine, though they occasionally missed the holiday freedom. Their enthusiasm for learning was infectious, and I found myself helping with homework more often than not. The weekend was spent indoors, as the weather turned particularly nippy. We hosted a small family gathering, where we shared stories and laughter over a hearty meal. The warmth of family bonds was a comforting contrast to the cold outside. As the week drew to a close, I felt a sense of accomplishment, both professionally and personally, as we navigated the early days of 2018 with purpose and joy.

Back home, my wife and I celebrated our 10th wedding anniversary. We decided to keep it low-key, enjoying a quiet dinner at our favorite restaurant. The evening was filled with reminiscing about our journey together, from the early days of dating to the present. The kids joined us for dessert, and we shared stories of their childhood adventures. The weekend was a mix of relaxation and productivity. We spent a lazy Sunday afternoon gardening, planting new flowers and herbs that would soon brighten our backyard. As the week ended, I felt grateful for the balance of work and family life, and the unexpected joys that each day brought.

Noah is a photographer with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on March 08), my wife (birthday on July 09), my child_1 (birthday on November 06), my child_2 (birthday on August 31), my child_3 (birthday on November 17), 
2) Joining a fitness and wellness retreat in Bali in week 6-7.

3) Join a local running club for weekend marathons every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 10.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)

Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

Noah is a chef with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on July 22), my wife (birthday on September 03), my child_1 (birthday on March 21), my father (birthday on February 16), my mother (birthday on February 04), 
2) Week-long road trip across the Pacific Coast Highway in week 27-28.

3) Join a historical walking tour of the city every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 14.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Noah for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 51 for graphic design studio use.
  - Designate Floor 99 for photography studio use.
  - Designate Floor 55 for music school use.
  - Designate Floor 7 for martial arts dojo use.
  - Designate Floor 35 for small cinema use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 63 to 67 for a extensive fitness and recreational gym.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a restaurant every 20 floors, starting from Floor 40
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
#*# Floor 1:

Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.

 Floor 2: 
This floor is dedicated to administrative offices, designed to support the skyscraper's operational needs. The layout includes open-plan workspaces, private offices, and meeting rooms. Key features include: 1) Open-Plan Workspaces: Spacious areas with modular desks and ergonomic chairs, promoting collaboration and flexibility. 2) Private Offices: Soundproofed rooms for executives and key personnel, equipped with state-of-the-art communication technology. 3) Meeting Rooms: Various sizes of meeting rooms, each equipped with video conferencing facilities and smart boards, facilitating both in-person and virtual meetings. The design emphasizes natural light, with large windows and glass partitions, creating a bright and productive environment.

 Floor 3: 
This floor houses the building's IT and data center facilities, ensuring robust technological support for all tenants. Key features include: 1) Server Rooms: Climate-controlled rooms housing servers and networking equipment, with redundant power supplies and advanced cooling systems. 2) IT Support Offices: Workspaces for IT staff, equipped with the latest technology for efficient troubleshooting and maintenance. 3) Security Systems: Comprehensive security infrastructure, including surveillance cameras and access control systems, ensuring the safety and integrity of the data center. The design prioritizes energy efficiency and sustainability, with green building materials and energy-efficient lighting.

 Floor 4: 
This floor is dedicated to human resources and employee services, providing essential support for the building's workforce. Key features include: 1) HR Offices: Private offices for HR personnel, equipped with secure filing systems and communication tools. 2) Training Rooms: Flexible spaces for workshops and training sessions, equipped with audio-visual technology. 3) Employee Lounge: A comfortable lounge area with seating, refreshment facilities, and recreational options, offering a relaxing space for employees during breaks. The design focuses on creating a welcoming and supportive environment, with warm colors and natural materials.

 Floor 5: 
This floor is designated for legal and compliance offices, providing a professional environment for legal services. Key features include: 1) Legal Offices: Private offices for legal teams, equipped with secure document storage and communication systems. 2) Conference Rooms: Soundproofed rooms for client meetings and legal consultations, equipped with video conferencing facilities. 3) Library: A resource library with legal texts and reference materials, supporting research and case preparation. The design emphasizes confidentiality and professionalism, with high-quality finishes and secure access.

 Floor 6: 
This floor is dedicated to financial services, offering a secure and efficient environment for financial operations. Key features include: 1) Finance Offices: Private offices for financial teams, equipped with secure document storage and communication tools. 2) Trading Floor: A high-tech trading floor with multiple monitors and advanced trading systems, facilitating real-time financial transactions. 3) Conference Rooms: Soundproofed rooms for financial meetings and client consultations, equipped with video conferencing facilities. The design prioritizes security and functionality, with reinforced walls and secure access systems.

 Floor 7: 
This floor is designated for a martial arts dojo, providing a spacious and versatile training environment. Key features include: 1) Training Area: A large, open space with tatami mats and training equipment, suitable for various martial arts disciplines. 2) Changing Rooms: Private changing rooms with lockers and showers, ensuring convenience and privacy for practitioners. 3) Meditation Room: A quiet room for meditation and relaxation, promoting mental and physical well-being. The design incorporates natural materials and calming colors, creating a serene and focused atmosphere.

 Floor 8: 
This floor is dedicated to wellness and health services, offering a range of facilities for physical and mental well-being. Key features include: 1) Fitness Center: A fully equipped gym with cardio machines, weightlifting equipment, and group exercise areas. 2) Spa and Sauna: A relaxing spa area with saunas, steam rooms, and massage services. 3) Counseling Rooms: Private rooms for mental health counseling and therapy sessions, providing a confidential and supportive environment. The design emphasizes tranquility and relaxation, with soft lighting and soothing colors.

 Floor 9: 
This floor is designated for creative studios, providing a dynamic environment for artists and designers. Key features include: 1) Art Studios: Spacious studios with natural light and ventilation, equipped with easels, drafting tables, and storage for art supplies. 2) Design Workshops: Flexible workshop spaces for collaborative projects, equipped with tools and materials for various design disciplines. 3) Exhibition Area: A gallery space for showcasing artwork and design projects, with adjustable lighting and display systems. The design encourages creativity and collaboration, with open layouts and vibrant colors.

 Floor 10: 
This floor is dedicated to technology and innovation, offering a cutting-edge environment for tech startups and innovators. Key features include: 1) Co-Working Spaces: Flexible workspaces with shared desks, private pods, and meeting rooms, fostering collaboration and innovation. 2) Innovation Labs: State-of-the-art labs equipped with the latest technology for research and development. 3) Demo Area: A space for product demonstrations and presentations, equipped with advanced audio-visual systems. The design emphasizes modernity and functionality, with sleek finishes and smart technology.

 Floor 11: 
This floor is designated for educational facilities, providing a versatile environment for learning and development. Key features include: 1) Classrooms: Soundproofed classrooms equipped with interactive whiteboards and audio-visual technology. 2) Lecture Halls: Large lecture halls with tiered seating and advanced projection systems, suitable for seminars and workshops. 3) Study Areas: Quiet study areas with comfortable seating and ample lighting, supporting individual learning and research. The design prioritizes flexibility and accessibility, with modular furniture and clear signage.

 Floor 12: 
This floor is dedicated to retail and dining, offering a vibrant shopping and dining experience. Key features include: 1) Retail Shops: A variety of retail shops offering fashion, accessories, and lifestyle products. 2) Dining Options: A range of dining options, from casual cafes to fine dining restaurants, catering to diverse tastes. 3) Lounge Area: A comfortable lounge area with seating and refreshment facilities, providing a relaxing space for shoppers and diners. The design emphasizes style and comfort, with elegant finishes and ambient lighting.

 Floor 13:

Key features include: 1) Conference Rooms: Multiple conference rooms of varying sizes, equipped with video conferencing facilities and smart boards. 2) Banquet Hall: A large banquet hall with flexible seating arrangements, suitable for weddings, corporate events, and social gatherings. 3) Event Planning Office: An office for event planners, equipped with planning tools and resources. The design focuses on functionality and flexibility, with modular furniture and advanced technology.

Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 19 for pharmacy use.
  - Designate Floor 74 for photography studio use.
  - Designate Floor 99 for yoga studio use.
  - Designate Floor 10 for daycare center use.
  - Designate Floor 34 for photography studio use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 28 to 33 for a hospital with various departments.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a outdoor terrace every 30 floors, starting from Floor 50
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***

Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 9 for tailor and custom dressmaking use.
  - Designate Floor 13 for martial arts dojo use.
  - Designate Floor 12 for boutique use.
  - Designate Floor 48 for baking and culinary school use.
  - Designate Floor 23 for art gallery use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 79 to 83 for a corporate headquarters for a major company.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a restaurant every 15 floors, starting from Floor 35
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
#*# Floor 1:

This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.

 Floor 2: 
This floor is dedicated to administrative offices, designed to maximize productivity and comfort for the building's staff. Key features include: 1) Open-Plan Layout: The floor utilizes an open-plan design to encourage collaboration and communication among employees. Glass partitions are used to maintain a sense of openness while providing necessary privacy. 2) Breakout Spaces: Scattered throughout the floor are several breakout spaces equipped with comfortable seating and whiteboards, perfect for brainstorming sessions or informal meetings. 3) Technology Integration: State-of-the-art technology is integrated throughout the office, including high-speed internet, smart boards, and ergonomic workstations, ensuring that employees have all the tools they need to succeed. This floor is designed to be a dynamic and efficient workspace, fostering a productive environment for all.

 Floor 3: 
This floor is home to a state-of-the-art fitness center, offering a variety of exercise options for building occupants. Key features include: 1) Gym Equipment: The fitness center is equipped with the latest gym machines, including treadmills, ellipticals, and weightlifting equipment, catering to all fitness levels. 2) Group Fitness Studio: A spacious studio is available for group classes such as yoga, Pilates, and spinning, providing a communal and motivating atmosphere. 3) Personal Training: On-site personal trainers are available to assist members with their fitness goals, offering personalized workout plans and guidance. The fitness center is designed to promote health and wellness, providing a convenient and comprehensive workout experience for all building occupants.

 Floor 4: 
This floor is dedicated to a luxurious spa and wellness center, offering a tranquil retreat for relaxation and rejuvenation. Key features include: 1) Treatment Rooms: The spa features several private treatment rooms for massages, facials, and other wellness therapies, each designed with calming colors and natural materials. 2) Sauna and Steam Room: A sauna and steam room are available for guests to unwind and detoxify, providing a serene environment for relaxation. 3) Meditation and Yoga Space: A dedicated area for meditation and yoga classes is equipped with soft lighting and soothing music, creating a peaceful atmosphere for mindfulness practices. This floor is designed to be a sanctuary of calm, offering a range of services to promote physical and mental well-being.

 Floor 5: 
This floor houses a modern conference center, equipped to host a variety of events and meetings. Key features include: 1) Conference Rooms: Multiple conference rooms of varying sizes are available, each equipped with the latest audio-visual technology to facilitate presentations and discussions. 2) Banquet Hall: A large banquet hall can accommodate up to 200 guests, featuring a stage, dance floor, and state-of-the-art lighting and sound systems. 3) Catering Services: On-site catering services are available to provide meals and refreshments for events, ensuring a seamless experience for all attendees. This floor is designed to be a versatile and professional venue, capable of hosting everything from corporate meetings to social gatherings.

 Floor 6: 
This floor is dedicated to a high-end retail space, featuring a curated selection of luxury brands. Key features include: 1) Boutique Layout: The retail space is designed with an open layout, allowing for easy navigation and a visually appealing display of products. 2) Exclusive Brands: A carefully selected range of luxury brands is showcased, offering high-quality fashion, accessories, and home goods. 3) Personal Shopping Services: Personal shoppers are available to assist customers, providing a bespoke shopping experience and expert advice. This floor is designed to be a premier shopping destination, offering an exclusive and personalized retail experience.

 Floor 7: 
This floor is home to a state-of-the-art media production studio, equipped to handle a variety of creative projects. Key features include: 1) Recording Studios: Multiple recording studios are available, each equipped with high-quality sound equipment and acoustically treated walls to ensure optimal sound quality. 2) Editing Suites: Editing suites are equipped with the latest video and audio editing software, allowing for seamless post-production work. 3) Green Screen Rooms: Green screen rooms are available for special effects and virtual production, providing a versatile space for creative experimentation. This floor is designed to be a cutting-edge facility for media production, offering all the tools and technology needed for professional-grade projects.

Key features include: 1) Open-Plan Workstations: The co-working space features an open-plan layout with flexible workstations, allowing for easy collaboration and networking. 2) Meeting Rooms: Several meeting rooms are available for private discussions and client meetings, equipped with video conferencing technology. 3) Lounge Areas: Comfortable lounge areas are provided for relaxation and informal meetings, featuring coffee and snack stations. This floor is designed to be a dynamic and supportive environment for creative professionals, offering a range of amenities to enhance productivity and collaboration.

This floor is designed to be a haven for fashion enthusiasts, offering expert tailoring services and a personalized shopping experience.

1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 32 for real estate agency use.
  - Designate Floor 77 for photography studio use.
  - Designate Floor 71 for language school use.
  - Designate Floor 18 for veterinary clinic use.
  - Designate Floor 49 for retail store use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 3 to 9 for a advanced technology and research institute.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a observatory every 30 floors, starting from Floor 50
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***

Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 32 for photography studio use.
  - Designate Floor 40 for legal services use.
  - Designate Floor 15 for retail store use.
  - Designate Floor 94 for retail store use.
  - Designate Floor 52 for office use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 72 to 77 for a extensive fitness and recreational gym.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a sky garden every 15 floors, starting from Floor 35
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
#*# Floor 1:

input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 01-21 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.2 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 05-13 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'Australia Day BBQ' on 01-26 with a special dish: Lamb Chops.
1.4 Celebrate 'April Fool's Surprise Menu' on 04-01 with a special dish: Mystery Dish.
1.5 Celebrate 'Restaurant's 10th Anniversary' on 09-19 with a special dish: Champagne and Caviar.
2) Feature 'Game Meat Fortnight' from Week 26 to Week 28 with dishes like: Venison Steaks.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 12, serving: Gourmet Burgers.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
As we continue our culinary journey, this week's menu highlights the vibrant flavors of the Mediterranean. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Bruschetta al Pomodoro: Crispy baguette slices topped with a fresh tomato and basil mixture. 1.2) Spanakopita: Flaky phyllo pastry filled with spinach and feta cheese. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Grilled Sea Bass: Sea bass marinated in lemon and herbs, grilled to perfection. 2.2) Lamb Tagine: Slow-cooked lamb with apricots and almonds in a rich, spiced sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Couscous Salad: Fluffy couscous mixed with roasted vegetables and a lemon vinaigrette. 3.2) Grilled Asparagus: Tender asparagus spears grilled and seasoned with olive oil and sea salt. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Baklava: Layers of phyllo pastry filled with nuts and honey. 4.2) Lemon Sorbet: Refreshing lemon sorbet to cleanse the palate. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Rosé Wine: A crisp rosé to complement the light and fresh dishes. 5.2) Mint Tea: Traditional mint tea served hot or iced. This week's menu transports you to the sun-drenched coasts of the Mediterranean, offering a delightful blend of flavors and aromas.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
This week, we celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' with a special focus on seafood. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Oysters Rockefeller: Oysters topped with a rich spinach and cheese mixture, baked until bubbly. 1.2) Crab Cakes: Light and fluffy crab cakes served with a tangy remoulade sauce. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Grilled Salmon: Fresh salmon fillet marinated in dill and lemon, grilled to perfection. 2.2) Lobster Risotto: Creamy risotto cooked with tender lobster pieces and a hint of saffron. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Sautéed Spinach: Fresh spinach sautéed with garlic and olive oil. 3.2) Roasted New Potatoes: Crispy on the outside, fluffy on the inside, seasoned with rosemary. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Lemon Tart: A buttery crust filled with a smooth lemon curd. 4.2) Berry Parfait: Layers of fresh berries and creamy yogurt. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Chardonnay: A full-bodied chardonnay to pair with the seafood. 5.2) Elderflower Spritz: A refreshing cocktail with elderflower liqueur and prosecco. This week's menu is a tribute to the bounty of the sea, featuring our special dish, Grilled Salmon, as the centerpiece of the Midsummer Night's Feast.

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
As we move into the heart of winter, this week's menu embraces the warmth of hearty, comforting dishes. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) French Onion Soup: Rich beef broth with caramelized onions and melted Gruyère cheese. 1.2) Pâté en Croûte: Savory meat pâté encased in a flaky pastry crust. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Beef Bourguignon: Slow-cooked beef in a red wine sauce with mushrooms and pearl onions. 2.2) Chicken Pot Pie: A creamy chicken and vegetable filling encased in a buttery pastry crust. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Mashed Rutabaga: Creamy mashed rutabaga seasoned with nutmeg. 3.2) Green Bean Almondine: Tender green beans sautéed with slivered almonds. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Fondant: A molten chocolate cake with a gooey center. 4.2) Apple Crumble: Warm apples topped with a crispy oat crumble. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Cabernet Sauvignon: A robust red wine to complement the rich flavors. 5.2) Hot Chocolate: A decadent hot chocolate with a hint of cinnamon. This week's menu offers a comforting escape from the cold, with dishes that are both hearty and satisfying.

 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th): 
This week, we explore the rich flavors of Asia with a menu inspired by traditional and modern techniques. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Edamame: Steamed young soybeans sprinkled with sea salt. 1.2) Spring Rolls: Crispy rolls filled with fresh vegetables and shrimp. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Teriyaki Chicken: Chicken glazed with a sweet and savory teriyaki sauce. 2.2) Beef Stir-Fry: Tender beef strips stir-fried with bell peppers and broccoli in a ginger soy sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Jasmine Rice: Fragrant jasmine rice cooked to perfection. 3.2) Vegetable Tempura: Assorted vegetables coated in a light tempura batter and deep-fried. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Mochi Ice Cream: Soft mochi filled with creamy ice cream. 4.2) Green Tea Cake: A moist cake infused with the subtle flavor of green tea. 5. This week's menu takes you on a culinary journey through Asia, offering a delightful mix of flavors and textures.

1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 03-28 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.2 Celebrate 'Valentine's Day Special' on 02-14 with a special dish: Heart-Shaped Red Velvet Cake.
1.3 Celebrate 'Easter Brunch' on 04-01 with a special dish: Spring Lamb Roast.
1.4 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 12-09 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
1.5 Celebrate 'Pancake Day Treat' on 02-13 with a special dish: Blueberry Pancakes.
2) Feature 'Winter Delicacies' from Week 17 to Week 18 with dishes like: Braised Game Meats.
3) Include 'Soup and Salad Midweek' every 2 weeks starting from Week 2, serving: Seasonal Soup and Salad.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
As we continue our culinary journey, this week features a delightful Soup and Salad Midweek. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Caramelized Onion Tartlets: Flaky pastry filled with sweet caramelized onions and Gruyère cheese. 1.2) Seared Scallops with Citrus Beurre Blanc: Perfectly seared scallops served with a tangy citrus butter sauce. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Beef Wellington: Tender filet mignon wrapped in puff pastry with a mushroom duxelles. 2.2) Herb-Crusted Rack of Lamb: Succulent lamb rack encrusted with rosemary and thyme, served with a red wine reduction. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Truffle Mashed Potatoes: Luxurious mashed potatoes infused with truffle oil. 3.2) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Crispy Brussels sprouts roasted with balsamic glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Lemon Sorbet: Refreshing lemon sorbet to cleanse the palate. 4.2) Crème Brûlée: Classic French dessert with a caramelized sugar crust. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Sparkling Rosé: A bubbly rosé to pair with the appetizers. 5.2) Port Wine: A rich port wine to accompany the desserts. Midweek, we serve a Seasonal Soup and Salad: 6. Soup: 6.1) Butternut Squash Soup: Creamy soup made from roasted butternut squash, garnished with toasted pumpkin seeds. 6.2) Salad: 6.3) Arugula and Pear Salad: Fresh arugula tossed with sliced pears, walnuts, and a honey vinaigrette. This week's menu offers a balance of rich flavors and refreshing elements, perfect for the start of the year.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
This week, we explore the vibrant flavors of the Mediterranean. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Spanakopita: Flaky phyllo pastry filled with spinach and feta cheese. 1.2) Grilled Octopus: Tender octopus grilled to perfection, served with a lemon-olive oil dressing. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Seafood Paella: A traditional Spanish dish with a medley of seafood, saffron-infused rice, and peas. 2.2) Lamb Kofta with Tzatziki: Spiced lamb meatballs served with a cool cucumber yogurt sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Greek Salad: A classic salad with tomatoes, cucumbers, olives, and feta cheese. 3.2) Roasted Eggplant: Smoky eggplant roasted with garlic and herbs. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Baklava: Layers of phyllo pastry filled with nuts and honey. 4.2) Greek Yogurt with Honey and Walnuts: Creamy yogurt topped with honey and crushed walnuts. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Assyrtiko White Wine: A crisp white wine from Santorini, perfect for seafood. 5.2) Ouzo: Anise-flavored spirit enjoyed with water and ice. This week's menu transports you to the sun-drenched shores of the Mediterranean, offering a feast of fresh and aromatic dishes.

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
As we delve into the heart of winter, this week features hearty and comforting dishes. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Beef Carpaccio: Thinly sliced raw beef drizzled with truffle oil and lemon. 1.2) Smoked Salmon Blinis: Smoked salmon served on mini pancakes with crème fraîche. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Coq au Vin: Chicken braised with wine, mushrooms, and bacon. 2.2) Beef Bourguignon: Slow-cooked beef in a rich red wine sauce with carrots and onions. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Buttered Green Beans: Tender green beans sautéed in butter. 3.2) Mashed Rutabaga: Creamy mashed rutabaga, a perfect winter root vegetable. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Fondant: Molten chocolate cake with a gooey center. 4.2) Apple Tarte Tatin: Upside-down caramelized apple tart. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Burgundy Red Wine: A full-bodied red wine to complement the beef dishes. 5.2) Hot Chocolate: Rich and creamy hot chocolate to warm you from the inside out. This week's menu offers a comforting embrace of classic French cuisine, perfect for the chilly days ahead.

 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th): 
This week, we celebrate the flavors of Asia with a fusion of traditional and modern dishes. 1. As we approach Valentine's Day, this week features romantic and indulgent dishes. 1. Drinks: 5.1) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the occasion. 5.2) Red Wine: A robust red wine to pair with the steak. As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Christmas Gala Dinner' on 12-25 with a special dish: Roasted Goose.
1.2 Celebrate 'Saint Patrick's Day' on 03-17 with a special dish: Irish Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'random of Year Party' on 11-06 with a special dish: Gourmet Cheese Platter.
1.4 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
1.5 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 08-31 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
2) Feature 'Squash and Pumpkin Delights' from Week 5 to Week 5 with dishes like: Pumpkin Pie.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 9, serving: Gourmet Burgers.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Christmas Gala Dinner' on 12-25 with a special dish: Roasted Goose.
1.2 Celebrate 'Memorial Day BBQ' on 09-03 with a special dish: Smoked Brisket.
1.3 Celebrate 'Mother's Day Meal' on 05-13 with a special dish: Eggs Benedict with Salmon.
1.4 Celebrate 'Bastille Day Party' on 07-14 with a special dish: Coq au Vin.
1.5 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 03-21 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
2) Feature 'Seafood Season Extravaganza' from Week 5 to Week 5 with dishes like: Fresh Seafood Platter.
3) Include 'Pasta Wednesdays' every 5 weeks starting from Week 18, serving: Spaghetti Carbonara.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
As we continue our culinary journey, this week's menu highlights the vibrant flavors of the Mediterranean. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Spanakopita: Flaky phyllo pastry filled with spinach and feta cheese. 1.2) Hummus Trio: A selection of classic, roasted red pepper, and beetroot hummus served with warm pita bread. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Grilled Lamb Chops: Juicy lamb chops marinated in rosemary and garlic, grilled to perfection. 2.2) Seafood Paella: A traditional Spanish dish with a medley of seafood, saffron-infused rice, and vibrant vegetables. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Greek Salad: A refreshing mix of tomatoes, cucumbers, olives, and feta cheese. 3.2) Roasted Asparagus: Tender asparagus spears roasted with olive oil and lemon zest. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Baklava: Layers of filo pastry filled with nuts and honey. 4.2) Lemon Sorbet: A zesty and refreshing palate cleanser. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Rosé Wine: A crisp and fruity rosé to complement the Mediterranean flavors. 5.2) Mint Tea: A soothing herbal tea to end the meal on a refreshing note. This week's menu transports diners to the sun-drenched coasts of the Mediterranean, offering a taste of its rich culinary heritage.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
This week, we embrace the hearty and comforting flavors of traditional American cuisine. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Buffalo Chicken Wings: Spicy and tangy wings served with blue cheese dressing. 1.2) Classic Deviled Eggs: Creamy egg yolks mixed with mustard and paprika, served in egg whites. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Beef Bourguignon: Slow-cooked beef in a rich red wine sauce with mushrooms and onions. 2.2) Southern Fried Chicken: Crispy chicken coated in seasoned flour and fried to golden perfection. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Mac and Cheese: Creamy and cheesy macaroni baked until bubbly. 3.2) Collard Greens: Tender greens cooked with smoked ham hock and vinegar. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Apple Pie: A classic dessert with a flaky crust and spiced apple filling. 4.2) Pecan Pie: A sweet and nutty pie with a buttery crust. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Bourbon: A smooth and rich bourbon to pair with the robust flavors. 5.2) Sweet Tea: A sweet and refreshing iced tea to cleanse the palate. This week's menu celebrates the diverse and comforting flavors of American cuisine, offering a taste of its rich culinary traditions.

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
As we move into the new year, this week's menu features the fresh and vibrant flavors of Asian cuisine. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Edamame: Steamed young soybeans sprinkled with sea salt. 1.2) Spring Rolls: Crispy rolls filled with fresh vegetables and vermicelli noodles. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Teriyaki Salmon: Salmon glazed with a sweet and savory teriyaki sauce. 2.2) Kung Pao Chicken: Spicy stir-fried chicken with peanuts and vegetables. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Steamed Jasmine Rice: Fragrant rice to accompany the main dishes. 3.2) Stir-Fried Bok Choy: Tender bok choy stir-fried with garlic and soy sauce. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Mochi Ice Cream: Soft and chewy mochi filled with creamy ice cream. 4.2) Green Tea Cake: A light and fluffy cake infused with matcha green tea. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Sake: A traditional Japanese rice wine to complement the flavors. 5.2) Lychee Tea: A fragrant and refreshing tea to end the meal. This week's menu offers a journey through the diverse and flavorful world of Asian cuisine, showcasing its unique ingredients and cooking techniques.

 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th): 
This week marks the beginning of our 'Seafood Season Extravaganza,' featuring the freshest seafood from the ocean. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Oysters on the Half Shell: Fresh oysters served with a mignonette sauce. 1.2) Crab Cakes: Lump crab meat mixed with herbs and spices, pan-fried to golden perfection. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Bisque: A creamy and rich soup made with fresh lobster stock. 2.2) Grilled Swordfish: Swordfish steaks marinated in lemon and herbs, grilled to perfection. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Seafood Chowder: A hearty chowder with a variety of seafood, potatoes, and cream. 3.2) Sautéed Spinach: Fresh spinach sautéed with garlic and olive oil. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Lemon Sorbet: A refreshing sorbet to cleanse the palate. 4.2) Chocolate Fondant: A molten chocolate cake with a gooey center. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Chardonnay: A crisp and fruity white wine to pair with the seafood. 5.2) Coconut Water: A hydrating and refreshing drink to accompany the meal. This week's menu celebrates the bounty of the sea, offering a variety of dishes that highlight the freshness and flavor of seafood.

 Menu Week 6 (February 5th - February 11th): 
Continuing our 'Seafood Season Extravaganza,' this week's menu features a variety of shellfish and fish dishes. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Shrimp Cocktail: Cold shrimp served with a tangy cocktail sauce. 1.2) Clam Chowder: A creamy chowder with clams, potatoes, and bacon. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Seared Scallops: Scallops seared to a golden brown and served with a citrus beurre blanc. 2.2) Blackened Catfish: Catfish coated in a spicy seasoning and pan-fried. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Grilled Corn on the Cob: Sweet corn grilled and slathered with butter and spices. 3.2) Coleslaw: A crunchy slaw with cabbage, carrots, and a tangy dressing. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Key Lime Pie: A tart and creamy pie with a graham cracker crust. 4.2) Tiramisu: A classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Sauvignon Blanc: A crisp and aromatic white wine to complement the seafood. 5.2) Ginger Ale: A fizzy and refreshing drink to cleanse the palate. This week's menu continues to celebrate the flavors of the sea, offering a variety of dishes that showcase the versatility and richness of seafood.

 Menu Week 7 (February 12th - February 18th): 
As we continue our 'Seafood Season Extravaganza,' this week's menu features a variety of seafood dishes with international influences. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Ceviche: Fresh fish marinated in lime juice and mixed with onions, cilantro, and chili peppers. 1.2) Calamari Fritti: Tender squid rings battered and fried until crispy. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Paella Valenciana: A traditional Spanish dish with rice, saffron, and a variety of seafood. 2.2) Thai Red Curry with Shrimp: A spicy and aromatic curry with coconut milk and vegetables. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Naan: Soft and fluffy Indian bread served with garlic butter. 3.2) Jasmine Rice: Fragrant rice to accompany the main dishes. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Mango Sticky Rice: Sweet sticky rice with fresh mango and coconut milk. 4.2) Panna Cotta: A creamy Italian dessert with a delicate vanilla flavor. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Riesling: A sweet and aromatic white wine to pair with the seafood. 5.2) Thai Iced Tea: A sweet and creamy tea with a hint of spice. This week's menu takes diners on a culinary journey around the world, showcasing the diverse ways in which seafood can be prepared and enjoyed.

 Menu Week 8 (February 19th - February 25th): 
As we approach the end of our 'Seafood Season Extravaganza,' this week's menu features a variety of seafood dishes with a focus on sustainability. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Tuna Tartare: Fresh tuna finely chopped and mixed with avocado, sesame seeds, and soy sauce. 1.2) Smoked Salmon Blinis: Smoked salmon served on mini pancakes with crème fraîche and dill. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Grilled Mahi-Mahi: Mahi-mahi marinated in lime and herbs, grilled to perfection. 2.2) Sustainable Fish Stew: A hearty stew made with sustainably sourced fish and vegetables. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Quinoa Salad: A refreshing salad with quinoa, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, and feta cheese. 3.2) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Brussels sprouts roasted with balsamic vinegar and honey. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Lemon Bars: A tangy and sweet dessert with a buttery crust. 4.2) Chocolate Mousse: A rich and creamy chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Pinot Grigio: A light and crisp white wine to pair with the seafood. 5.2) Sparkling Water: A refreshing and hydrating drink to cleanse the palate. This week's menu highlights the importance of sustainability in seafood, offering a variety of dishes that showcase the flavors and versatility of responsibly sourced fish.
